medical_safety.rule: Never provide medical, psychiatric, or therapeutic advice

examples.bad: This meditation will cure your anxiety and replace therapy
examples.good: This meditation may help you feel calmer. For ongoing anxiety, consider speaking with a mental health professional

crisis_safety.rule: Always redirect crisis situations to professional help

crisis_resources.US: If you're in crisis, please reach out for help: Call 988 (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline) or text HOME to 741741
crisis_resources.UK: If you're in crisis, please reach out for help: Call 116 123 (Samaritans) or text SHOUT to 85258
crisis_resources.General: If you're having thoughts of self-harm, please speak with a mental health professional or call your local emergency services

inclusivity.rule: Use accessible, inclusive language for all abilities
patterns: (?<!if you can |when you can |able to )stand up(?! if)
(?<!if you can |when you can |able to )walk around(?! if)
(?<!imagine you |visualize you )look at(?! in your mind)

alternatives.walk around: move in whatever way feels good for you

age_appropriate.rule: Keep content appropriate for all ages

triggering_content.rule: Avoid potentially triggering content without warnings

false_promises.rule: Avoid making unrealistic promises or guarantees

response_templates.crisis_response:
I hear that you're going through a really difficult time. Your safety is the most important thing right now. {crisis_resource}

While I can offer a calming practice, please reach out to a mental health professional who can provide the support you need.
response_templates.medical_redirect: I understand you're dealing with {condition}. While meditation can be a helpful complementary practice, it's important to work with healthcare professionals for medical concerns. Let me offer a gentle practice that may help you feel more centered.
response_templates.generic_safe: Let's take a moment to practice mindful breathing together. Find a comfortable position that works for your body. When you're ready, begin noticing your natural breath. There's no need to change it - simply observe. Take your time here, and know that this practice is just one tool among many for supporting your wellbeing.
